title: Populations and Growing Demand for Animal Protein

content.question: Respond to parts A, B, C, D, and all subparts. (a) Identify one factor that contributes to the high crude death rate in countries that have never experienced the changes that result from a demographic transition.

frqParts.text: Respond to parts A, B, C, D, and all subparts. (a) Identify one factor that contributes to the high crude death rate in countries that have never experienced the changes that result from a demographic transition.
(b) Describe a typical age structure diagram for a developing country.

Demographic data from 2018 are shown in the table below. 2018 Demographic Data Population (millions) Crude Birth Rate (per 1,000 individuals) Crude Death Rate (per 1,000 individuals) World <math alttext="7,621" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>7</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>621</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="19" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>19</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="7" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> More developed countries <math alttext="1,266" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>266</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Less developed countries <math alttext="6,355" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>355</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="21" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>21</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="7" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> (c) Use the data in the table to answer the following questions. (i) Calculate the percent of the global population that was living in more developed countries in 2018. Show your work. (ii) Calculate the population growth rate (as a percent) for less developed countries. Show your work.

(d) As countries change during a demographic transition, there is often a growing demand for meat in human diets. It takes an estimated <math alttext="1,750" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>750</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> liters of water to produce <math alttext="113" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>113</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> grams of beef. The average person in a more developed country consumes <math alttext="85" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>85</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> grams of beef per day. (i) Calculate the amount of water needed, in liters per year, to produce the beef consumed by one person in a more developed country. Show your work. (ii) Make a claim to propose a solution that would reduce the amount of water required to produce enough food for individuals. (iii) Describe one environmental disadvantage associated with increasing the amount of meat in human diets, other than associated with consumption of water.
